newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Placer says has over half of Highlands.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Placer says has over half of Highlands.

text.p: Placer Dome Inc said on Thursday it now held more than 50 percent of takeover target Highlands Gold Ltd.
The A$0.75 a share offer is due to close on January 18.
"We are pleased with the level of acceptances we have received to date and are looking forward to closing our offer on Saturday," Placer Dome chief executive John Willson said in a statement.
Highlands' board had urged shareholders to reject the offer, saying the company was worth significantly more than Placer's bid.
Placer had amassed a 33.3 percent stake in Highlands, which has 25 percent of the Porgera gold mine in Papua New Guinea, before launching its bid in November.
Placer currently holds a 25 percent stake in Porgera through its listed Placer Pacific Ltd unit, for which it has also launched a takeover bid.

Earlier on Thursday, Highlands said talks with potential underwriters of a Highlands restructuring were continuing but said it was unlikely that a proposal would be completed before the closing of Placer Dome's offer.
Directors of Highlands said they continued to recommend that shareholders reject Placer's offer as it undervalued Highlands and a restructuring would be in the best interests of all shareholders.

Highlands said Placer's indicated objective was to acquire all of Highland's interest in Porgera, and in the event that it did not compulsorily acquire all outstanding shares, a further proposal may be presented to Highlands shareholders.
